channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Making nightmares into reality: AI finds fans in the Islamic State, other militant and terrorist other groups worldwide
item.description: “One of the best things about AI is how easy it is to use,” said someone on a pro-IS site last month.

item.title: How to stand out when you’re one of two job candidates
item.description: Some studies show that the interview process can take up to six weeks. But there are ways that might help speed up the process and get those final hir...

item.title: 3 Tips to Give Your Kids the Best Holiday Present You Can Get—a Healthier Relationship With Screens
item.description: The author of a new book aimed at helping kids get off their phones explains how to use the holidays to reset your family’s relationship with their de...

item.title: Tight jeans, oversized sweatpants, and cozy joggers: the three leadership styles that define every workplace
item.description: What can a pair of pants tell you about leadership? Much more than you think. How do you feel when you pull a pair of non-stretch jeans straight from ...

item.title: Fed chair favorite Kevin Hassett on potential independence from Trump: ‘His opinion matters if it’s good, if it’s based on data’
item.description: On Friday, Trump said he “certainly should have a role" in Fed policy. "I’ve done great. I’ve made a lot of money ... I think my voice should be heard...

item.title: Deloitte’s CTO on a stunning AI transformation stat: companies are spending 93% on tech and only 7% on people
item.description: Bill Briggs recognizes an old inertia inside the boardroom: "I felt it in my travels, but I hadn't been able to quantify it."

item.title: CNBC Replaces Its Peacock with . . . a Triangle
item.description: The logo update comes as CNBC spins off from its parent company.

item.title: 8 Experts’ Work and Technology Predictions for AI in 2026
item.description: The new tools are rapidly changing the workplace, and these professors say many companies aren’t ready.

item.title: Rob Reiner, comedy legend who directed ‘When Harry Met Sally’ and ‘Spinal Tap,’ dead at 78
item.description: Reiner and his wife, Michele Singer, were found dead Sunday at their home in the Brentwood neighborhood of Los Angeles.

item.title: How to transform AI from a tool into a partner
item.description: The conversation about AI in the workplace has been dominated by the simplistic narrative that machines will inevitably replace humans. But the organi...

item.title: If you want to be a better boss, science says stop serving feedback sandwiches
item.description: I was taught to use a so-called “feedback sandwich” to give constructive feedback : lead with a positive, share the negative, finish with a positive. ...

item.title: 8 Books to Read That Will Help You Lead in 2026
item.description: We asked authors to recommend books for leaders seeking advice, solace, or just a darn good read as they navigate the uncertainty of the year to come.

item.title: Italian cuisine, and even the rituals surrounding it, get an official UNESCO world heritage designation
item.description: “This tradition of being at the table, of stopping for a while at lunch, a bit longer at dinner ... it’s not very common around the world."

item.title: Neuroscience Just Showed How 1 Type of Activity Stops Your Brain From Aging
item.description: You might think it’s just a hobby. It’s also a powerful tool for brain health.

item.title: The AI revolution is making everything from PCs to smartphones even more expensive
item.description: If you’re planning on buying a PC, laptop, or cell phone in the coming months, a word of advice for you before Christmas: Buy now, not later. Prices a...
